mridul, get more out of your new Android device
Dear mridul,

Your shiny, new device is powered by Android, which comes with a Google  
Account  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uE1gxl3okThqoAKCAl7fl3mI8uwGSIwbHceUImjCYAEebvwp-nxtgX16YBwamU-pZPSPtGYVMn_sqYwUJRZMqH0rvhjz9nb-yoIGYnGQ22MpqFxBh2sbYD72kP9TmAV-NiEw2yJV8TB6IxUjpETy6sa6NIpqqAEc3AcQ_dos2xwcw>  
so you get access to lots of Google stuff. Here are a few tips to help you  
get the most out of it.

--------

Play  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uHQK1Cc3KFmwnTrtPDzMDvHZjRZjyS8Mm-NdVqPyqaqhCLkXw1KU2yjpvStou0jrGJLDgT5Su7g5hR9JgaPCwtOi0JDLE3iaBPdNZwKxUyJyJeDu_2Ig71TH6eKJqwPspvp4UZ7f0tXb4xC8xudUPcrM6l5rhcK7t8PGcg>

Apps and entertainment
Check out Google Play  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uG0rSVbldHI5JIWamfvU_LouR6ZiSd-8uEfdBnvfQwH1Ger0USMLo5FZGgDi1HTJevmMAclJq-hrEuMHXTZkLunmVsz_blaNLfdFOsj7cHb6Eb3ZRZIWRnZpAnUwIahQgAhR6SKcY6Xl4SbAVR3qA8DGRvdESPrKmPhCnOk>  
to download the latest apps, games, music and more.

--------

Google Search  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uFkb3SI7tie_OZtys1fkgCegM3SHsoP9MqgfBalt_nakbhbrqdiP1JBs8zA9SMtZGRW39kKDTKchscumabA5UARf5dBhzt3kvK26gokByxeFMjgRlXbvd-GsWRvgWBK-7r58YN2sZYxJoVosxYUYxhXyD3ga4RlNTUNnsNwb9BafI0LSUqfcQFd5X7Ma-cbn24CIs3u_zMoDrsZnkC1NN_W4FKl4PlpnVpUjD2_rrZpEX9Be7q9hQ>

The best of Google built-in
With the Google app, you can talk to Google to get stuff done and stay a  
step ahead with Now cards for traffic, weather and more.
Get more tips  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uENMNY3GPVtql7gz23COztAQ6A5JbKCs3FPaRQGijkH3SZVG6gPtHe7f1vkzpmnynaIwtjazPt153nW8TM6IfWDgE_3sxGIHM-J-MKEqICB3q9q_ImTA4anU_lLUaU7ljOrNuaT6fSYRkmk86zjYmvquiM8KlEGCSfi1-2SJ3FSxNzDNFR6dA>.


TRY IT  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uFUtRwF9pQKx1iLsIktZHlarUBHM6F36dUl-hXcoYQQVaKMnbHesuEkirBSsEB_fWsu9Sdnh2h5TqLtYzWWW6hv5myGfvd05DcL59tajZyWniKsEfCliOP0I6lQk1KDO9-4xZjhrfIARrcLi3VMAd3aSjbWsk5jmKZlRQiFMpUOJmsqNGvovVIb2Mnk9shMLOsLfFySuQRbyhsfqfnv2ZZ6io6gIGynRE-4p8erKyrV814MJVBV>

--------

Trust shield  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uHsKD81xCe6-OdOGTaYrKlbGHH4DSW84VRchf-1vG5h_ILDWX41YT2X1VdvxrpQAgItzbcb32maMTPFSyTpLUVJ--bfgN9fxsXEdBBib2ofk7boJCp9Ukwp5l8RSFs0NX26h5aLW82l1WZFW3LVv6kQSeF1bN41MLGQh0Px5qbA8YA>

You're in control
Choose what’s right for you. You can review and adjust your privacy and  
security settings at any time in My Account  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uHhke3LLFiowQm6CYGuAC0tWBncf08k979yaKm7cAPn1kjEx63TaIsD9XuveHGqbeQH1PLQgRopoVad_9Sxo6F_nwiMvzhb4J31tnzWZxzrsEPwzDMoZCSbgSa1IR7S-gf4JISBO0z-ux3M9TrTF_j72VlA2ADqEmRVvEu-7b52JqY>.

--------

Replies to this email aren’t monitored. If you have a question about your  
new account, the Help Centre  
<https://www.google.com/appserve/mkt/p/AFOm0uEnlQsKKLMeieZt-h9SlCXlk7ORJj1DY0lHRS72sBgOkHRlk4tY1otwMGsfPVYt-eI0Ux-sYe0AGSkgju5qSZoiqD_IgfXe7g5BgP5Q6ZAzBOCK2cdaCZ31YaLLl182cf_Fl8MneGf1W1cuX4UEnyNHImKmXYDPobebEahHYjIJ>  
likely has the answer that you’re looking for.

We hope you enjoy your new Android device,
Google Community Team

Improvements to our Privacy Policy and Privacy Controls
mror1822@gmail.com

This month, we’re updating our Privacy Policy to make it easier for you to  
understand what information we collect and why we collect it. We’ve also  
taken steps to improve our Privacy Checkup and other controls that we  
provide to safeguard your data and protect your privacy.

Nothing is changing about your current settings or how your information is  
processed. Rather, we’ve improved the way we describe our practices and how  
we explain the options you have to update, manage, export and delete your  
data.

We’re making these updates as new data protection regulations come into  
effect in the European Union, and we’re taking the opportunity to make  
improvements for Google users around the world.

Making our Privacy Policy easier to understand

Simpler structure & clearer language

We’ve improved the navigation and organisation of the policy to make it  
easier to find what you’re looking for. We’ve also explained our practices  
in more detail and with clearer language.

New descriptive videos & illustrations

Often a visual description is easier to understand than text alone, so  
we’ve added short videos and illustrations throughout the policy.

Embedded privacy controls

We’ve made it easier to jump to key settings directly from the policy,  
helping you make choices about your privacy.

The revised policy is available here  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=mror1822%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fpolicies.google.com%2Fprivacy%2Fupdate%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
and will take effect on 25 May 2018.

Improving your privacy controls

Within the past year, we updated My Activity  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=mror1822%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyactivity.google.com%2Fmyactivity%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
so that you can better access and manage the data in your Google Account.  
We also launched a redesigned Dashboard  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=mror1822%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2Fdashboard%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>,  
which allows you to easily see an overview of products that you’re using  
and your data associated with them.

This month, we’ve updated our Privacy Checkup  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=mror1822%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2Fprivacycheckup%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>  
with new illustrations and examples to help you make more informed choices  
about your key privacy controls. And since we understand that your  
preferences may change over time, the new Privacy Checkup enables you to  
sign up for regular reminders to check your privacy settings.

To learn more about these and other controls to manage your privacy, visit  
your Google Account  
<https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?Email=mror1822%40gmail.com&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fmyaccount.google.com%2F%3Futm_source%3Dpp-email%26utm_medium%3Demail%26utm_campaign%3Dglobal>.

(c) 2018 Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

Your Gmail address, rormridul7@gmail.com, has been created
*Welcome to Gmail!* You can log in to your account at
https://mail.google.com/.

Here are a couple of tips to help you get started:

   - *Use Gmail's import tools* to move emails and contacts
   <http://support.google.com/mail/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=56283> from
   your other email accounts to your new Gmail address.
   - *Download the mobile app* for Android
   <https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.gm&hl=en>
   or iPhone and iPad
   <https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/gmail-email-from-google/id422689480?mt=8>
   to stay connected on the go.

Should you ever encounter problems with your account or forget your
password, we will contact you at this address.

Enjoy!

The Gmail Team

        mso-font-alt:'Arial'
    }

                    <a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://t1.edurev.com:443/question/457096/Practice-TestQuiz-or-MCQ--Multiple-Choice-Question?referrer=utm_source%3dedurev_email_ForumUpvote_3_8_2019&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=edurev_email_ForumUpvote">
                        <div style="font-size: 24px; color: #333333; margin-bottom: 20px;"><!--forumsepratorstart--><div><div><strong>Practice Test/Quiz or MCQ (Multiple Choice Questions) with Solutions </strong>of<strong> Chapter &quot;Motion&quot;</strong> are available for <strong>CBSE Class 9 Science</strong> and have been compiled as per the <strong>syllabus of CBSE Class 9 Science</strong></div><div><strong>Q &nbsp;</strong>A body moves in a uniform circular motion</div></div><!--forumsepratorend--><ul style='font-size: 17px;line-height: 1.4;list-style: none;'><li style='clear:both;'><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: 20px;'>a)</div><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: calc(100% - 20px);'><div>it is moving with constant velocity.</div></div></li><li style='clear:both;'><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: 20px;'>b)</div><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: calc(100% - 20px);'><div>its acceleration is zero</div></div></li><li style='clear:both;'><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: 20px;'>c)</div><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: calc(100% - 20px);'><div>the body has an acceleration</div></div></li><li style='clear:both;'><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: 20px;'>d)</div><div style='float: left;display:inline;width: calc(100% - 20px);'><div>none of these</div></div></li></ul><div style='clear: both;'>Correct answer is 'C'. Can you explain this answer?</div></div>
                    </a>
                    <div style="display: flex; text-align: left; padding-bottom: 10px; border-bottom: 1px solid #e4e4e4">
                        <div style="float: left; display: inline-block; margin-right: 20px;">
                            <a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://t1.edurev.com:443/2622868?public=true&referrer=utm_source%3dedurev_email_ForumUpvote_3_8_2019&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=edurev_email_ForumUpvote">
                                <img style="max-width: 50px;" src="https://cdn3.edurev.in/AllImages/short/student%20images/profilepics/d7ab8cf5-91ba-4d0d-908a-a1b975857453.jpeg" /></a>
                        </div>
                        <div style="float: left; display: inline; width: calc(100% - 70px);">
                            <div style="float: left; display: inline-block; width: 100%;">
                                <div>
                                    <a href="https://t1.edurev.com:443/2622868?public=true&referrer=utm_source%3dedurev_email_ForumUpvote_3_8_2019&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=edurev_email_ForumUpvote" style="text-decoration: none;"><span style="color: #183f68; font-size: 21px; font-weight: 700; width: 100%; display: inline-block;">Mridul Chaudhary</span></a>
                                </div>
                                <div style="padding-top: 5px;">
                                    <a style="text-decoration: none;" href="https://t1.edurev.com:443/question/457096/Practice-TestQuiz-or-MCQ--Multiple-Choice-Question?referrer=utm_source%3dedurev_email_ForumUpvote_3_8_2019&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=edurev_email_ForumUpvote">
                                        <div style="font-size: 22px; color: #333333;">Accelerating objects are objects which are changing their velocity - either the speed (i.e., magnitude of the velocity vector) or the direction. An object undergoing uniform circular motion is moving with a constant speed. Nonetheless, it is accelerating due to its change in direction.</div>
                                    </a>
                                </div>
                            </div>

				width: 33% !important;
			}

				width: 66% !important;
			}

			<tr style="vertical-align: top;" valign="top">
				<td style="word-break: break-word; vertical-align: top; border-collapse: collapse;" valign="top">
					<!--[if (mso)|(IE)]><table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0"><tr><td align="center" style="background-color:#FFFFFF"><![endif]-->
					<div style="background-color:transparent;">

			}

			.mobile_hide {
				min-height: 0px;
				max-height: 0px;
				max-width: 0px;
				display: none;
				overflow: hidden;
				font-size: 0px;
			}

			.desktop_hide {
				display: block !important;
				max-height: none !important;
			}
		}
	</style>
</head>

					<!--[if (mso)|(IE)]><table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0"><tr><td align="center" style="background-color:#FFFFFF"><![endif]-->
					<div style="background-color:transparent;">

				max-width: 100% !important;
				display: block !important;
			}

			.block-grid {
				width: 100% !important;
			}

				width: 100% !important;
			}

				margin: 0 auto;
			}

			img.fullwidth,
			img.fullwidthOnMobile {
				max-width: 100% !important;
			}

				display: table-cell !important;
			}

	</style>
</head>

                          </table>
                        </td>

                      <!-- END E A T S H - - - - - - -->




                  </tbody>

</td>

</tbody>
</table>
<!-- END LIST-->

<span data-blockuuid="38c60f76-10d3-4582-859d-a098950ec015" style="display: none; max-height: 0px; font-size: 0px; overflow: hidden; mso-hide: all;">

<table width="100%" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="background-color:#d6d6d5;border:0;border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;mso-table-lspace:0;mso-table-rspace:0" bgcolor="#d6d6d5" class="">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td align="center" style="display: block;">
<!--[if (gte mso 9)|(IE)]>
<table width="700" align="center" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">

   <tbody>
      <tr>
         <td>
            <table width="600" bgcolor="#e8eaed" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" align="center" class="devicewidth">
               <tbody>
                  <tr>
                     <td width="100%">
                        <table width="600" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" align="center" class="devicewidth">
                           <tbody>
                              <!-- Spacing -->
                              <tr>
                                 <td width="100%" height="20"></td>
                              </tr>
                              <!-- Spacing -->
                              <tr>
                                 <td>
                                    <!-- logo -->
                           <table width="580" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" align="center" class="devicewidth">
                              <tbody>
                                 <tr>

   <tbody>
      <tr>
         <td>
            <table width="600" bgcolor="#e8eaed" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" align="center" class="devicewidth">
               <tbody>
                  <tr>
                     <td width="100%">
                        <table width="600" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" align="center" class="devicewidth">
                           <tbody>
                              <!-- Spacing -->
                              <tr>
                                 <td width="100%" height="20"></td>

                              <!-- Spacing -->
                              <tr>

  h1, h2, .h1, .h2, .mobh1, .mobh2 {font-size: 34px !important;line-height: 40px !important;}

}
</style>

		<!-- Travel back in Time -->
   <table width="100%" bgcolor="#f6f4f5" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" id="backgroundTable" st-sortable="bigimage">
